definition[0]: a noise like the sound of something being crushed
example[0]: The only sound was the crunch of tyres on gravel.
definition[1]: a difficult situation caused by a lack of something, especially money or time
example[1]: Three new teachers were hired to help ease the crunch.
example[2]: Cost cutting had enabled the organization to survive a previous cash crunch.
definition[2]: an exercise in which you lie on your back and lift your head and shoulders off the ground to make your stomach muscles strong
definition[3]: to make a sound like something being crushed
example[3]: Their boots crunched loudly on the frozen snow.
definition[4]: to eat hard food in a way that makes a noise
example[4]: The dog was crunching on a bone.
definition[5]: to do very complicated calculations on large amounts of DATA (=information stored on a computer) in order to find out about something
example[5]: Media buyers have to know whatâ€™s going on, not just how to crunch numbers.
